file_insights.purpose: Chat message input interface with send button
key_features: Send button with disabled state handling

patterns_discovered.description: Wrapping existing button component with Tooltip higher-order component rather than modifying button internals
Leveraging pre-built Tooltip component from shared UI library
patterns_discovered.benefit: Consistency across application, reduced code duplication

patterns_discovered.description: Component maintains aria-label and disabled state handling while adding tooltip enhancement
patterns_discovered.benefit: Improves UX for screen readers and keyboard navigation

patterns_discovered.description: Utility-first CSS approach for button styling with hover and disabled states

gotchas_discovered.description: Ensure Tooltip displays correctly when button is disabled (opacity-40 state)
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Tooltip component should handle pointer-events and opacity transitions gracefully

approach_outcome.description: Successfully wrapped the send button with Tooltip component in first attempt. Implementation required only adding import statement and wrapping existing button element without modifying any props or logic.

recommendations.recommendation: Verify Tooltip content/title is configured appropriately for the send button
recommendations.rationale: Tooltip component should display helpful text about button functionality

recommendations.recommendation: Test Tooltip behavior with disabled send button state
recommendations.rationale: Ensure tooltip remains accessible and visible when button is disabled

recommendations.recommendation: Review other buttons in the application for Tooltip consistency
recommendations.rationale: Similar send/action buttons might benefit from tooltip enhancement for better UX

recommendations.recommendation: Verify Tooltip interoperability with existing aria-label attribute
recommendations.rationale: Ensure screen readers handle both aria-label and tooltip content appropriately
